Author: Trump
Full.Text: Friends, delegates and fellow Americans: I humbly and gratefully accept your nomination for the presidency of the United States.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Together, we will lead our party back to the White House, and we will lead our country back to safety, prosperity, and peace. We will be a country of generosity and warmth. But we will also be a country of law and order.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Our Convention occurs at a moment of crisis for our nation. The attacks on our police, and the terrorism in our cities, threaten our very way of life. Any politician who does not grasp this danger is not fit to lead our country.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Americans watching this address tonight have seen the recent images of violence in our streets and the chaos in our communities. Many have witnessed this violence personally, some have even been its victims.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I have a message for all of you: the crime and violence that today afflicts our nation will soon come to an end. Beginning on January 20th 2017, safety will be restored.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: The most basic duty of government is to defend the lives of its own citizens. Any government that fails to do so is a government unworthy to lead.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: It is finally time for a straightforward assessment of the state of our nation.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I will present the facts plainly and honestly. We cannot afford to be so politically correct anymore.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: So if you want to hear the corporate spin, the carefully-crafted lies, and the media myths the Democrats are holding their convention next week.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: But here, at our convention, there will be no lies. We will honor the American people with the truth, and nothing else.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: These are the facts:

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Decades of progress made in bringing down crime are now being reversed by this Administration’s rollback of criminal enforcement.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Homicides last year increased by 17% in America’s fifty largest cities. That’s the largest increase in 25 years. In our nation’s capital, killings have risen by 50 percent. They are up nearly 60% in nearby Baltimore.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: In the President’s hometown of Chicago, more than 2,000 have been the victims of shootings this year alone. And more than 3,600 have been killed in the Chicago area since he took office.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: The number of police officers killed in the line of duty has risen by almost 50% compared to this point last year. Nearly 180,000 illegal immigrants with criminal records, ordered deported from our country, are tonight roaming free to threaten peaceful citizens.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: The number of new illegal immigrant families who have crossed the border so far this year already exceeds the entire total from 2015. They are being released by the tens of thousands into our communities with no regard for the impact on public safety or resources.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: One such border-crosser was released and made his way to Nebraska. There, he ended the life of an innocent young girl named Sarah Root. She was 21 years-old, and was killed the day after graduating from college with a 4.0 Grade Point Average. Her killer was then released a second time, and he is now a fugitive from the law.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I’ve met Sarah’s beautiful family. But to this Administration, their amazing daughter was just one more American life that wasn’t worth protecting. One more child to sacrifice on the altar of open borders. What about our economy?

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Again, I will tell you the plain facts that have been edited out of your nightly news and your morning newspaper: Nearly Four in 10 African-American children are living in poverty, while 58% of African American youth are not employed. 2 million more Latinos are in poverty today than when the President took his oath of office less than eight years ago. Another 14 million people have left the workforce entirely.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Household incomes are down more than $4,000 since the year 2000. Our manufacturing trade deficit has reached an all-time high – nearly $800 billion in a single year. The budget is no better.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: President Obama has doubled our national debt to more than $19 trillion, and growing. Yet, what do we have to show for it? Our roads and bridges are falling apart, our airports are in Third World condition, and forty-three million Americans are on food stamps.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Now let us consider the state of affairs abroad.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Not only have our citizens endured domestic disaster, but they have lived through one international humiliation after another. We all remember the images of our sailors being forced to their knees by their Iranian captors at gunpoint.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: This was just prior to the signing of the Iran deal, which gave back to Iran $150 billion and gave us nothing – it will go down in history as one of the worst deals ever made. Another humiliation came when president Obama drew a red line in Syria – and the whole world knew it meant nothing.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: In Libya, our consulate – the symbol of American prestige around the globe – was brought down in flames. America is far less safe – and the world is far less stable – than when Obama made the decision to put Hillary Clinton in charge of America’s foreign policy.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I am certain it is a decision he truly regrets. Her bad instincts and her bad judgment – something pointed out by Bernie Sanders – are what caused the disasters unfolding today. Let’s review the record. In 2009, pre-Hillary, ISIS was not even on the map.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Libya was cooperating. Egypt was peaceful. Iraq was seeing a reduction in violence. Iran was being choked by sanctions. Syria was under control. After four years of Hillary Clinton, what do we have? ISIS has spread across the region, and the world. Libya is in ruins, and our Ambassador and his staff were left helpless to die at the hands of savage killers. Egypt was turned over to the radical Muslim brotherhood, forcing the military to retake control. Iraq is in chaos.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Iran is on the path to nuclear weapons. Syria is engulfed in a civil war and a refugee crisis that now threatens the West. After fifteen years of wars in the Middle East, after trillions of dollars spent and thousands of lives lost, the situation is worse than it has ever been before.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: This is the legacy of Hillary Clinton: death, destruction and weakness.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: But Hillary Clinton’s legacy does not have to be America’s legacy. The problems we face now – poverty and violence at home, war and destruction abroad – will last only as long as we continue relying on the same politicians who created them. A change in leadership is required to change these outcomes. Tonight, I will share with you my plan of action for America.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: The most important difference between our plan and that of our opponents, is that our plan will put America First. Americanism, not globalism, will be our credo. As long as we are led by politicians who will not put America First, then we can be assured that other nations will not treat America with respect. This will all change in 2017.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: The American People will come first once again. My plan will begin with safety at home – which means safe neighborhoods, secure borders, and protection from terrorism. There can be no prosperity without law and order. On the economy, I will outline reforms to add millions of new jobs and trillions in new wealth that can be used to rebuild America.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: A number of these reforms that I will outline tonight will be opposed by some of our nation’s most powerful special interests. That is because these interests have rigged our political and economic system for their exclusive benefit.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Big business, elite media and major donors are lining up behind the campaign of my opponent because they know she will keep our rigged system in place. They are throwing money at her because they have total control over everything she does. She is their puppet, and they pull the strings.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: That is why Hillary Clinton’s message is that things will never change. My message is that things have to change – and they have to change right now. Every day I wake up determined to deliver for the people I have met all across this nation that have been neglected, ignored, and abandoned.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I have visited the laid-off factory workers, and the communities crushed by our horrible and unfair trade deals. These are the forgotten men and women of our country. People who work hard but no longer have a voice.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I AM YOUR VOICE.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I have embraced crying mothers who have lost their children because our politicians put their personal agendas before the national good. I have no patience for injustice, no tolerance for government incompetence, no sympathy for leaders who fail their citizens.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: When innocent people suffer, because our political system lacks the will, or the courage, or the basic decency to enforce our laws – or worse still, has sold out to some corporate lobbyist for cash – I am not able to look the other way.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: And when a Secretary of State illegally stores her emails on a private server, deletes 33,000 of them so the authorities can’t see her crime, puts our country at risk, lies about it in every different form and faces no consequence – I know that corruption has reached a level like never before.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: When the FBI Director says that the Secretary of State was “extremely careless” and “negligent,” in handling our classified secrets, I also know that these terms are minor compared to what she actually did. They were just used to save her from facing justice for her terrible crimes.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: In fact, her single greatest accomplishment may be committing such an egregious crime and getting away with it – especially when others have paid so dearly. When that same Secretary of State rakes in millions of dollars trading access and favors to special interests and foreign powers I know the time for action has come.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I have joined the political arena so that the powerful can no longer beat up on people that cannot defend themselves. Nobody knows the system better than me, which is why I alone can fix it. I have seen firsthand how the system is rigged against our citizens, just like it was rigged against Bernie Sanders – he never had a chance.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: But his supporters will join our movement, because we will fix his biggest issue: trade. Millions of Democrats will join our movement because we are going to fix the system so it works for all Americans. In this cause, I am proud to have at my side the next Vice President of the United States: Governor Mike Pence of Indiana.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: We will bring the same economic success to America that Mike brought to Indiana. He is a man of character and accomplishment. He is the right man for the job. The first task for our new Administration will be to liberate our citizens from the crime and terrorism and lawlessness that threatens their communities.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: America was shocked to its core when our police officers in Dallas were brutally executed. In the days after Dallas, we have seen continued threats and violence against our law enforcement officials. Law officers have been shot or killed in recent days in Georgia, Missouri, Wisconsin, Kansas, Michigan and Tennessee.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: On Sunday, more police were gunned down in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. Three were killed, and four were badly injured. An attack on law enforcement is an attack on all Americans. I have a message to every last person threatening the peace on our streets and the safety of our police: when I take the oath of office next year, I will restore law and order our country.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I will work with, and appoint, the best prosecutors and law enforcement officials in the country to get the job done. In this race for the White House, I am the Law And Order candidate. The irresponsible rhetoric of our President, who has used the pulpit of the presidency to divide us by race and color, has made America a more dangerous environment for everyone.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: This Administration has failed America’s inner cities. It’s failed them on education. It’s failed them on jobs. It’s failed them on crime. It’s failed them at every level.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: When I am President, I will work to ensure that all of our kids are treated equally, and protected equally.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Every action I take, I will ask myself: does this make life better for young Americans in Baltimore, Chicago, Detroit, Ferguson who have as much of a right to live out their dreams as any other child America?

Author: Trump
Full.Text: To make life safe in America, we must also address the growing threats we face from outside America: we are going to defeat the barbarians of ISIS. Once again, France is the victim of brutal Islamic terrorism.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Men, women and children viciously mowed down. Lives ruined. Families ripped apart. A nation in mourning.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: The damage and devastation that can be inflicted by Islamic radicals has been over and over – at the World Trade Center, at an office party in San Bernardino, at the Boston Marathon, and a military recruiting center in Chattanooga, Tennessee.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Only weeks ago, in Orlando, Florida, 49 wonderful Americans were savagely murdered by an Islamic terrorist. This time, the terrorist targeted our LGBT community. As your President, I will do everything in my power to protect our LGBT citizens from the violence and oppression of a hateful foreign ideology. To protect us from terrorism, we need to focus on three things.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: We must have the best intelligence gathering operation in the world. We must abandon the failed policy of nation building and regime change that Hillary Clinton pushed in Iraq, Libya, Egypt and Syria. Instead, we must work with all of our allies who share our goal of destroying ISIS and stamping out Islamic terror.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: This includes working with our greatest ally in the region, the State of Israel. Lastly, we must immediately suspend immigration from any nation that has been compromised by terrorism until such time as proven vetting mechanisms have been put in place.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: My opponent has called for a radical 550% increase in Syrian refugees on top of existing massive refugee flows coming into our country under President Obama. She proposes this despite the fact that there’s no way to screen these refugees in order to find out who they are or where they come from. I only want to admit individuals into our country who will support our values and love our people.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Anyone who endorses violence, hatred or oppression is not welcome in our country and never will be.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Decades of record immigration have produced lower wages and higher unemployment for our citizens, especially for African-American and Latino workers. We are going to have an immigration system that works, but one that works for the American people.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: On Monday, we heard from three parents whose children were killed by illegal immigrants Mary Ann Mendoza, Sabine Durden, and Jamiel Shaw. They are just three brave representatives of many thousands. Of all my travels in this country, nothing has affected me more deeply than the time I have spent with the mothers and fathers who have lost their children to violence spilling across our border.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: These families have no special interests to represent them. There are no demonstrators to protest on their behalf. My opponent will never meet with them, or share in their pain. Instead, my opponent wants Sanctuary Cities. But where was sanctuary for Kate Steinle? Where was Sanctuary for the children of Mary Ann, Sabine and Jamiel? Where was sanctuary for all the other Americans who have been so brutally murdered, and who have suffered so horribly?

Author: Trump
Full.Text: These wounded American families have been alone. But they are alone no longer. Tonight, this candidate and this whole nation stand in their corner to support them, to send them our love, and to pledge in their honor that we will save countless more families from suffering the same awful fate.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: We are going to build a great border wall to stop illegal immigration, to stop the gangs and the violence, and to stop the drugs from pouring into our communities. I have been honored to receive the endorsement of America’s Border Patrol Agents, and will work directly with them to protect the integrity of our lawful immigration system.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: By ending catch-and-release on the border, we will stop the cycle of human smuggling and violence. Illegal border crossings will go down. Peace will be restored. By enforcing the rules for the millions who overstay their visas, our laws will finally receive the respect they deserve.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Tonight, I want every American whose demands for immigration security have been denied – and every politician who has denied them – to listen very closely to the words I am about to say.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: On January 21st of 2017, the day after I take the oath of office, Americans will finally wake up in a country where the laws of the United States are enforced. We are going to be considerate and compassionate to everyone.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: But my greatest compassion will be for our own struggling citizens. My plan is the exact opposite of the radical and dangerous immigration policy of Hillary Clinton. Americans want relief from uncontrolled immigration. Communities want relief.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Yet Hillary Clinton is proposing mass amnesty, mass immigration, and mass lawlessness. Her plan will overwhelm your schools and hospitals, further reduce your jobs and wages, and make it harder for recent immigrants to escape from poverty.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I have a different vision for our workers. It begins with a new, fair trade policy that protects our jobs and stands up to countries that cheat. It’s been a signature message of my campaign from day one, and it will be a signature feature of my presidency from the moment I take the oath of office.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I have made billions of dollars in business making deals – now I’m going to make our country rich again. I am going to turn our bad trade agreements into great ones. America has lost nearly-one third of its manufacturing jobs since 1997, following the enactment of disastrous trade deals supported by Bill and Hillary Clinton.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Remember, it was Bill Clinton who signed NAFTA, one of the worst economic deals ever made by our country.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Never again.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I am going to bring our jobs back to Ohio and to America – and I am not going to let companies move to other countries, firing their employees along the way, without consequences.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: My opponent, on the other hand, has supported virtually every trade agreement that has been destroying our middle class. She supported NAFTA, and she supported China’s entrance into the World Trade Organization – another one of her husband’s colossal mistakes.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: She supported the job killing trade deal with South Korea. She has supported the Trans-Pacific Partnership. The TPP will not only destroy our manufacturing, but it will make America subject to the rulings of foreign governments. I pledge to never sign any trade agreement that hurts our workers, or that diminishes our freedom and independence. Instead, I will make individual deals with individual countries.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: No longer will we enter into these massive deals, with many countries, that are thousands of pages long – and which no one from our country even reads or understands. We are going to enforce all trade violations, including through the use of taxes and tariffs, against any country that cheats.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: This includes stopping China’s outrageous theft of intellectual property, along with their illegal product dumping, and their devastating currency manipulation. Our horrible trade agreements with China and many others, will be totally renegotiated. That includes renegotiating NAFTA to get a much better deal for America – and we’ll walk away if we don’t get the deal that we want. We are going to start building and making things again.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Next comes the reform of our tax laws, regulations and energy rules. While Hillary Clinton plans a massive tax increase, I have proposed the largest tax reduction of any candidate who has declared for the presidential race this year – Democrat or Republican. Middle-income Americans will experience profound relief, and taxes will be simplified for everyone.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: America is one of the highest-taxed nations in the world. Reducing taxes will cause new companies and new jobs to come roaring back into our country. Then we are going to deal with the issue of regulation, one of the greatest job-killers of them all. Excessive regulation is costing our country as much as $2 trillion a year, and we will end it. We are going to lift the restrictions on the production of American energy. This will produce more than $20 trillion in job creating economic activity over the next four decades.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: My opponent, on the other hand, wants to put the great miners and steel workers of our country out of work – that will never happen when I am President. With these new economic policies, trillions of dollars will start flowing into our country.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: This new wealth will improve the quality of life for all Americans – We will build the roads, highways, bridges, tunnels, airports, and the railways of tomorrow. This, in turn, will create millions more jobs. We will rescue kids from failing schools by helping their parents send them to a safe school of their choice.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: My opponent would rather protect education bureaucrats than serve American children. We will repeal and replace disastrous Obamacare. You will be able to choose your own doctor again. And we will fix TSA at the airports! We will completely rebuild our depleted military, and the countries that we protect, at a massive loss, will be asked to pay their fair share.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: We will take care of our great Veterans like they have never been taken care of before. My opponent dismissed the VA scandal as being not widespread – one more sign of how out of touch she really is. We are going to ask every Department Head in government to provide a list of wasteful spending projects that we can eliminate in my first 100 days. The politicians have talked about it, I’m going to do it. We are also going to appoint justices to the United States Supreme Court who will uphold our laws and our Constitution.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: The replacement for Justice Scalia will be a person of similar views and principles. This will be one of the most important issues decided by this election. My opponent wants to essentially abolish the 2nd amendment. I, on the other hand, received the early and strong endorsement of the National Rifle Association and will protect the right of all Americans to keep their families safe.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: At this moment, I would like to thank the evangelical community who have been so good to me and so supportive. You have so much to contribute to our politics, yet our laws prevent you from speaking your minds from your own pulpits.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: An amendment, pushed by Lyndon Johnson, many years ago, threatens religious institutions with a loss of their tax-exempt status if they openly advocate their political views.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I am going to work very hard to repeal that language and protect free speech for all Americans. We can accomplish these great things, and so much else – all we need to do is start believing in ourselves and in our country again. It is time to show the whole world that America Is Back – bigger, and better and stronger than ever before.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: In this journey, I’m so lucky to have at my side my wife Melania and my wonderful children, Don, Ivanka, Eric, Tiffany, and Barron: you will always be my greatest source of pride and joy. My Dad, Fred Trump, was the smartest and hardest working man I ever knew. I wonder sometimes what he’d say if he were here to see this tonight.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: It’s because of him that I learned, from my youngest age, to respect the dignity of work and the dignity of working people. He was a guy most comfortable in the company of bricklayers, carpenters, and electricians and I have a lot of that in me also. Then there’s my mother, Mary. She was strong, but also warm and fair-minded. She was a truly great mother. She was also one of the most honest and charitable people I have ever known, and a great judge of character.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: To my sisters Mary Anne and Elizabeth, my brother Robert and my late brother Fred, I will always give you my love you are most special to me. I have loved my life in business.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: But now, my sole and exclusive mission is to go to work for our country – to go to work for all of you. It’s time to deliver a victory for the American people. But to do that, we must break free from the petty politics of the past.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: America is a nation of believers, dreamers, and strivers that is being led by a group of censors, critics, and cynics.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Remember: all of the people telling you that you can’t have the country you want, are the same people telling you that I wouldn’t be standing here tonight. No longer can we rely on those elites in media, and politics, who will say anything to keep a rigged system in place.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: Instead, we must choose to Believe In America. History is watching us now.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: It’s waiting to see if we will rise to the occasion, and if we will show the whole world that America is still free and independent and strong.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: My opponent asks her supporters to recite a three-word loyalty pledge. It reads: “I’m With Her”. I choose to recite a different pledge.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: My pledge reads: “I’M WITH YOU – THE AMERICAN PEOPLE.”

Author: Trump
Full.Text: I am your voice.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: So to every parent who dreams for their child, and every child who dreams for their future, I say these words to you tonight: I’m With You, and I will fight for you, and I will win for you.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: To all Americans tonight, in all our cities and towns, I make this promise: We Will Make America Strong Again.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: We Will Make America Proud Again.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: We Will Make America Safe Again.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: And We Will Make America Great Again.

Author: Trump
Full.Text: THANK YOU.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Thank you! Thank you for that amazing welcome.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And Chelsea, thank you.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I’m so proud to be your mother and so proud of the woman you’ve become.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Thanks for bringing Marc into our family, and Charlotte and Aidan into the world.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And Bill, that conversation we started in the law library 45 years ago is still going strong.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It’s lasted through good times that filled us with joy, and hard times that tested us.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And I’ve even gotten a few words in along the way.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: On Tuesday night, I was so happy to see that my Explainer-in-Chief is still on the job.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I’m also grateful to the rest of my family and the friends of a lifetime.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: To all of you whose hard work brought us here tonight…

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And to those of you who joined our campaign this week.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And what a remarkable week it’s been.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We heard the man from Hope, Bill Clinton.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And the man of Hope, Barack Obama.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: America is stronger because of President Obama’s leadership, and I’m better because of his friendship.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We heard from our terrific vice president, the one-and-only Joe Biden, who spoke from his big heart about our party’s commitment to working people.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: First Lady Michelle Obama reminded us that our children are watching, and the president we elect is going to be their president, too.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And for those of you out there who are just getting to know Tim Kaine – you’re soon going to understand why the people of Virginia keep promoting him: from city council and mayor, to Governor, and now Senator.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He’ll make the whole country proud as our Vice President.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And… I want to thank Bernie Sanders.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Bernie, your campaign inspired millions of Americans, particularly the young people who threw their hearts and souls into our primary.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: You’ve put economic and social justice issues front and center, where they belong.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And to all of your supporters here and around the country:

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I want you to know, I’ve heard you.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Your cause is our cause.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Our country needs your ideas, energy, and passion.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That’s the only way we can turn our progressive platform into real change for America.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We wrote it together – now let’s go out there and make it happen together.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: My friends, we’ve come to Philadelphia – the birthplace of our nation – because what happened in this city 240 years ago still has something to teach us today.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We all know the story.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But we usually focus on how it turned out - and not enough on how close that story came to never being written at all.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: When representatives from 13 unruly colonies met just down the road from here, some wanted to stick with the King.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Some wanted to stick it to the king, and go their own way.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: The revolution hung in the balance.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Then somehow they began listening to each other … compromising … finding common purpose.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And by the time they left Philadelphia, they had begun to see themselves as one nation.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That’s what made it possible to stand up to a King.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That took courage.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: They had courage.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Our Founders embraced the enduring truth that we are stronger together.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: America is once again at a moment of reckoning.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Powerful forces are threatening to pull us apart.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Bonds of trust and respect are fraying.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And just as with our founders, there are no guarantees.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It truly is up to us.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We have to decide whether we all will work together so we all can rise together.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Our country’s motto is e pluribus unum: out of many, we are one.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Will we stay true to that motto?

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Well, we heard Donald Trump’s answer last week at his convention.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He wants to divide us - from the rest of the world, and from each other.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He’s betting that the perils of today’s world will blind us to its unlimited promise.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He’s taken the Republican Party a long way…

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: from “Morning in America” to “Midnight in America.”

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He wants us to fear the future and fear each other.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Well, a great Democratic President, Franklin Delano Roosevelt, came up with the perfect rebuke to Trump more than eighty years ago, during a much more perilous time.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: “The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.”

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Now we are clear-eyed about what our country is up against.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But we are not afraid.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We will rise to the challenge, just as we always have.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We will not build a wall.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Instead, we will build an economy where everyone who wants a good paying job can get one.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And we’ll build a path to citizenship for millions of immigrants who are already contributing to our economy!

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We will not ban a religion.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We will work with all Americans and our allies to fight terrorism.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: There’s a lot of work to do.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Too many people haven’t had a pay raise since the crash.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: There’s too much inequality.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Too little social mobility.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Too much paralysis in Washington.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Too many threats at home and abroad.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But just look at the strengths we bring to meet these challenges.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We have the most dynamic and diverse people in the world.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We have the most tolerant and generous young people we’ve ever had.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We have the most powerful military.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: The most innovative entrepreneurs.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: The most enduring values.Freedom and equality, justice and opportunity.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We should be so proud that these words are associated with us. That when people

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: hear them – they hear… America.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: So don’t let anyone tell you that our country is weak.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We’re not.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Don’t let anyone tell you we don’t have what it takes.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We do.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And most of all, don’t believe anyone who says: “I alone can fix it.”

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Those were actually Donald Trump’s words in Cleveland.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And they should set off alarm bells for all of us.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Really?

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I alone can fix it?

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Isn’t he forgetting?

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Troops on the front lines.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Police officers and fire fighters who run toward danger.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Doctors and nurses who care for us.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Teachers who change lives.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Entrepreneurs who see possibilities in every problem.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Mothers who lost children to violence and are building a movement to keep other kids safe.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He’s forgetting every last one of us.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Americans don’t say: “I alone can fix it.”

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We say: “We’ll fix it together.”

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Remember: Our Founders fought a revolution and wrote a Constitution so America would never be a nation where one person had all the power.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Two hundred and forty years later, we still put our faith in each other.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Look at what happened in Dallas after the assassinations of five brave police officers.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Chief David Brown asked the community to support his force, maybe even join them.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And you know how the community responded?

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Nearly 500 people applied in just 12 days.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That’s how Americans answer when the call for help goes out.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: 20 years ago I wrote a book called “It Takes a Village.” A lot of people looked at the title and asked, what the heck do you mean by that?

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: This is what I mean.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: None of us can raise a family, build a business, heal a community or lift a country totally alone.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: America needs every one of us to lend our energy, our talents, our ambition to making our nation better and stronger.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I believe that with all my heart.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That’s why “Stronger Together” is not just a lesson from our history.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It’s not just a slogan for our campaign.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It’s a guiding principle for the country we’ve always been and the future we’re going to build.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: A country where the economy works for everyone, not just those at the top.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Where you can get a good job and send your kids to a good school, no matter what zip code you live in.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: A country where all our children can dream, and those dreams are within reach.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Where families are strong… communities are safe…

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And yes, love trumps hate.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That’s the country we’re fighting for.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That’s the future we’re working toward…

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And so it is with humility… determination … and boundless confidence in America’s promise… that I accept your nomination for President of the United

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: States!

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Now, sometimes the people at this podium are new to the national stage.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: As you know, I’m not one of those people.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I’ve been your First Lady. Served 8 years as a Senator from the great State of New York.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I ran for President and lost.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Then I represented all of you as Secretary of State.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But my job titles only tell you what I’ve done.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: They don’t tell you why.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: The truth is, through all these years of public service, the “service” part has always come easier to me than the “public” part.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I get it that some people just don’t know what to make of me.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: So let me tell you.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: The family I’m from … well, no one had their name on big buildings.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: My family were builders of a different kind.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Builders in the way most American families are.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: They used whatever tools they had – whatever God gave them – and whatever life in America provided – and built better lives and better futures for their kids.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: My grandfather worked in the same Scranton lace mill for 50 years.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Because he believed that if he gave everything he had, his children would have a better life than he did.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And he was right.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: My dad, Hugh, made it to college. He played football at Penn State and enlisted in the Navy after Pearl Harbor.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: When the war was over he started his own small business, printing fabric for draperies.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I remember watching him stand for hours over silk screens.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He wanted to give my brothers and me opportunities he never had.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And he did. My mother, Dorothy, was abandoned by her parents as a young girl. She ended up on her own at 14, working as a house maid.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: She was saved by the kindness of others.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Her first grade teacher saw she had nothing to eat at lunch, and brought extra food to share.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: The lesson she passed on to me years later stuck with me:

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: No one gets through life alone.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We have to look out for each other and lift each other up.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: She made sure I learned the words of our Methodist faith:

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: “Do all the good you can, for all the people you can, in all the ways you can, as long as ever you can.”

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I went to work for the Children’s Defense Fund, going door-to-door in New Bedford, Massachusetts on behalf of children with disabilities who were denied the chance

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: to go to school.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I remember meeting a young girl in a wheelchair on the small back porch of her house.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: She told me how badly she wanted to go to school – it just didn’t seem possible.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And I couldn’t stop thinking of my mother and what she went through as a child.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It became clear to me that simply caring is not enough.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: To drive real progress, you have to change both hearts and laws.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: You need both understanding and action.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: So we gathered facts. We built a coalition. And our work helped convince Congress to ensure access to education for all students with disabilities.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It’s a big idea, isn’t it?

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Every kid with a disability has the right to go to school.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But how do you make an idea like that real? You do it step-by-step, year-by-year… sometimes even door-by-door.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And my heart just swelled when I saw Anastasia Somoza on this stage, representing millions of young people who – because of those changes to our laws – are able to get an education.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It’s true… I sweat the details of policy – whether we’re talking about the exact level of lead in the drinking water in Flint, Michigan, the number of mental health facilities in Iowa, or the cost of your prescription drugs.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Because it’s not just a detail if it’s your kid - if it’s your family.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It’s a big deal. And it should be a big deal to your president.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Over the last three days, you’ve seen some of the people who’ve inspired me.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: People who let me into their lives, and became a part of mine.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: People like Ryan Moore and Lauren Manning.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: They told their stories Tuesday night.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I first met Ryan as a seven-year old.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He was wearing a full body brace that must have weighed forty pounds.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Children like Ryan kept me going when our plan for universal health care failed…and kept me working with leaders of both parties to help create the Children’s Health Insurance Program that covers 8 million kids every year.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Lauren was gravely injured on 9/11.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It was the thought of her, and Debbie St. John, and John Dolan and Joe Sweeney, and all the victims and survivors, that kept me working as hard as I could in the Senate on behalf of 9/11 families, and our first responders who got sick from their time at Ground Zero.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I was still thinking of Lauren, Debbie and all the others ten years later in the White House Situation Room when President Obama made the courageous decision that finally brought Osama bin Laden to justice.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: In this campaign, I’ve met so many people who motivate me to keep fighting for change.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And, with your help, I will carry all of your voices and stories with me to the White House.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I will be a President for Democrats, Republicans, and Independents.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: For the struggling, the striving and the successful.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: For those who vote for me and those who don’t.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: For all Americans.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Tonight, we’ve reached a milestone in our nation’s march toward a more perfect union:

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: the first time that a major party has nominated a woman for President.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Standing here as my mother’s daughter, and my daughter’s mother, I’m so happy this day has come.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Happy for grandmothers and little girls and everyone in between.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Happy for boys and men, too – because when any barrier falls in America, for anyone, it clears the way for everyone. When there are no ceilings, the sky’s the limit.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: So let’s keep going, until every one of the 161 million women and girls across America has the opportunity she deserves.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Because even more important than the history we make tonight, is the history we will write together in the years ahead.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Let’s begin with what we’re going to do to help working people in our country get ahead and stay ahead.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Now, I don’t think President Obama and Vice President Biden get the credit they deserve for saving us from the worst economic crisis of our lifetimes.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Our economy is so much stronger than when they took office. Nearly 15 million new private-sector jobs. Twenty million more Americans with health insurance. And an auto industry that just had its best year ever. That’s real progress.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But none of us can be satisfied with the status quo. Not by a long shot.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We’re still facing deep-seated problems that developed long before the recession and have stayed with us through the

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: recovery.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I’ve gone around our country talking to working families. And I’ve heard from so many of you who feel like the economy just isn’t working.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Some of you are frustrated – even furious.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And you know what??? You’re right.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It’s not yet working the way it should.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Americans are willing to work – and work hard.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But right now, an awful lot of people feel there is less and less respect for the work they do.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And less respect for them, period.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Democrats are the party of working people.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But we haven’t done a good enough job showing that we get what you’re going through,

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: and that we’re going to do something about it.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: So I want to tell you tonight how we will empower Americans to live better lives.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: My primary mission as President will be to create more opportunity and more good jobs with rising wages right here in the United States…

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: From my first day in office to my last!

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Especially in places that for too long have been left out and left behind.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: From our inner cities to our small towns, from Indian Country to Coal Country.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: From communities ravaged by addiction to regions hollowed out by plant closures.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And here’s what I believe.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I believe America thrives when the middle class thrives.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I believe that our economy isn’t working the way it should because our democracy isn’t working the way it should.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That’s why we need to appoint Supreme Court justices who will get money out of politics and expand voting rights, not restrict them. And we’ll pass a constitutional amendment to overturn Citizens United!

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I believe American corporations that have gotten so much from our country should be just as patriotic in return.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Many of them are. But too many aren’t.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It’s wrong to take tax breaks with one hand and give out pink slips with the other.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And I believe Wall Street can never, ever be allowed to wreck Main Street again.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I believe in science. I believe that climate change is real and that we can save our planet while creating millions of good-paying clean energy jobs.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I believe that when we have millions of hardworking immigrants contributing to our economy, it would be self-defeating and inhumane to kick them out.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Comprehensive immigration reform will grow our economy and keep families together - and it’s the right thing to do.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Whatever party you belong to, or if you belong to no party at all, if you share these beliefs, this is your campaign.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: If you believe that companies should share profits with their workers, not pad executive bonuses, join us.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: If you believe the minimum wage should be a living wage… and no one working full time should have to raise their children in poverty… join us.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: If you believe that every man, woman, and child in America has the right to affordable health care…join us.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: If you believe that we should say “no” to unfair trade deals… that we should stand up to China… that we should support our steelworkers and autoworkers and homegrown manufacturers…join us.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: If you believe we should expand Social Security and protect a woman’s right to make her own health care decisions… join us.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And yes, if you believe that your working mother, wife, sister, or daughter deserves equal pay… join us…

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Let’s make sure this economy works for everyone, not just those at the top.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Now, you didn’t hear any of this from Donald Trump at his convention.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He spoke for 70-odd minutes – and I do mean odd.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And he offered zero solutions. But we already know he doesn’t believe these things.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: No wonder he doesn’t like talking about his plans.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: You might have noticed, I love talking about mine.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: In my first 100 days, we will work with both parties to pass the biggest investment in new, good-paying jobs since World War II.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Jobs in manufacturing, clean energy, technology and innovation, small business, and infrastructure.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: If we invest in infrastructure now, we’ll not only create jobs today, but lay the foundation for the jobs of the future.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And we will transform the way we prepare our young people for those jobs.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Bernie Sanders and I will work together to make college tuition-free for the middle class and debt-free for all!

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We will also liberate millions of people who already have student debt.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It’s just not right that Donald Trump can ignore his debts, but students and families can’t refinance theirs.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And here’s something we don’t say often enough: College is crucial, but a four-year degree should not be the only path to a good job.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We’re going to help more people learn a skill or practice a trade and make a good living doing it.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We’re going to give small businesses a boost. Make it easier to get credit. Way too many dreams die in the parking lots of banks.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: In America, if you can dream it, you should be able to build it.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We’re going to help you balance family and work. And you know what, if fighting for affordable child care and paid family leave is playing the “woman card,” then Deal Me In!

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: (Oh, you’ve heard that one?)

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Now, here’s the thing, we’re not only going to make all these investments, we’re going to pay for every single one of them.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And here’s how: Wall Street, corporations, and the super-rich are going to start paying their fair share of taxes.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Not because we resent success. Because when more than 90% of the gains have gone to the top 1%, that’s where the money is.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And if companies take tax breaks and then ship jobs overseas, we’ll make them

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: pay us back. And we’ll put that money to work where it belongs … creating jobs here at home!

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Now I know some of you are sitting at home thinking, well that all sounds pretty good.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But how are you going to get it done? How are you going to break through the gridlock in Washington? Look at my record. I’ve worked across the aisle to pass laws and treaties and to launch new programs that help millions of people. And if you give me the chance, that’s what I’ll do as President.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But Trump, he’s a businessman. He must know something about the economy.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Well, let’s take a closer look.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: In Atlantic City, 60 miles from here, you’ll find contractors and small businesses who lost everything because Donald Trump refused to pay his bills.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: People who did the work and needed the money, and didn’t get it – not because he couldn’t pay them, but because he wouldn’t pay them.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That sales pitch he’s making to be your president? Put your faith in him – and you’ll win big? That’s the same sales pitch he made to all those small businesses. Then Trump walked away, and left working people holding the bag.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He also talks a big game about putting America First. Please explain to me what part of America First leads him to make Trump ties in China, not Colorado.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Trump suits in Mexico, not Michigan. Trump furniture in Turkey, not Ohio. Trump picture frames in India, not Wisconsin.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Donald Trump says he wants to make America great again – well, he could start by actually making things in America again.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: The choice we face is just as stark when it comes to our national security.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Anyone reading the news can see the threats and turbulence we face.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: From Baghdad and Kabul, to Nice and Paris and Brussels, to San Bernardino and Orlando, we’re dealing with determined enemies that must be defeated.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: No wonder people are anxious and looking for reassurance. Looking for steady leadership.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: You want a leader who understands we are stronger when we work with our allies around the world and care for our veterans here at home. Keeping our nation safe and honoring the people who do it will be my highest priority.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I’m proud that we put a lid on Iran’s nuclear program without firing a single shot – now we have to enforce it, and keep supporting Israel’s security.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I’m proud that we shaped a global climate agreement – now we have to hold every country accountable to their commitments, including ourselves.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I’m proud to stand by our allies in NATO against any threat they face, including from Russia.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I’ve laid out my strategy for defeating ISIS.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We will strike their sanctuaries from the air, and support local forces taking them out on the ground. We will surge our intelligence so that we detect and prevent attacks before they happen.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We will disrupt their efforts online to reach and radicalize young people in our country.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It won’t be easy or quick, but make no mistake – we will prevail.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Now Donald Trump says, and this is a quote, “I know more about ISIS than the generals do….”

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: No, Donald, you don’t.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He thinks that he knows more than our military because he claimed our armed forces are “a disaster.”

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Well, I’ve had the privilege to work closely with our troops and our veterans for many years, including as a Senator on the Armed Services Committee.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I know how wrong he is. Our military is a national treasure.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We entrust our commander-in-chief to make the hardest decisions our nation faces.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Decisions about war and peace. Life and death.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: A president should respect the men and women who risk their lives to serve our country – including the sons of Tim Kaine and Mike Pence, both Marines.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Ask yourself: Does Donald Trump have the temperament to be Commander-in-Chief?

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Donald Trump can’t even handle the rough-and-tumble of a presidential campaign.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He loses his cool at the slightest provocation. When he’s gotten a tough question from a reporter. When he’s challenged in a debate. When he sees a protestor at a rally.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Imagine him in the Oval Office facing a real crisis. A man you can bait with a tweet is not a man we can trust with nuclear weapons.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I can’t put it any better than Jackie Kennedy did after the Cuban Missile Crisis. She said that what worried President Kennedy during that very dangerous time was that a war might be started – not by big men with self-control and restraint, but by little men – the ones moved by fear and pride.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: America’s strength doesn’t come from lashing out.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Strength relies on smarts, judgment, cool resolve, and the precise and strategic application of power.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That’s the kind of Commander-in-Chief I pledge to be.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And if we’re serious about keeping our country safe, we also can’t afford to have a President who’s in the pocket of the gun lobby.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I’m not here to repeal the 2nd Amendment.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I’m not here to take away your guns.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I just don’t want you to be shot by someone who shouldn’t have a gun in the first place.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We should be working with responsible gun owners to pass common-sense reforms and keep guns out of the hands of criminals, terrorists and all others who would do us harm.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: For decades, people have said this issue was too hard to solve and the politics were too hot to touch.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But I ask you: how can we just stand by and do nothing?

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: You heard, you saw, family members of people killed by gun violence.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: You heard, you saw, family members of police officers killed in the line of duty because they were outgunned by criminals.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I refuse to believe we can’t find common ground here.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We have to heal the divides in our country.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Not just on guns. But on race. Immigration. And more.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That starts with listening to each other. Hearing each other. Trying, as best we can, to walk in each other’s shoes.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: So let’s put ourselves in the shoes of young black and Latino men and women who face the effects of systemic racism, and are made to feel like their lives are disposable.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Let’s put ourselves in the shoes of police officers, kissing their kids and spouses goodbye every day and heading off to do a dangerous and necessary job.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We will reform our criminal justice system from end-to-end, and rebuild trust between law enforcement and the communities they serve.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We will defend all our rights – civil rights, human rights and voting rights… women’s rights and workers’ rights… LGBT rights and the rights of people with disabilities!

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And we will stand up against mean and divisive rhetoric wherever it comes from.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: For the past year, many people made the mistake of laughing off Donald Trump’s comments – excusing him as an entertainer just putting on a show.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: They think he couldn’t possibly mean all the horrible things he says – like when he called women “pigs.” Or said that an American judge couldn’t be fair because of his Mexican heritage. Or when he mocks and mimics a reporter with a disability.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Or insults prisoners of war like John McCain –a true hero and patriot who deserves our respect.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: At first, I admit, I couldn’t believe he meant it either.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: It was just too hard to fathom – that someone who wants to lead our nation could say those things. Could be like that.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But here’s the sad truth: There is no other Donald Trump…This is it.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And in the end, it comes down to what Donald Trump doesn’t get: that America is great – because America is good.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: So enough with the bigotry and bombast. Donald Trump’s not offering real change.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: He’s offering empty promises. What are we offering? A bold agenda to improve the lives of people across our country - to keep you safe, to get you good jobs, and to give your kids the opportunities they deserve.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: The choice is clear.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Every generation of Americans has come together to make our country freer, fairer, and stronger.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: None of us can do it alone.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I know that at a time when so much seems to be pulling us apart, it can be hard to imagine how we’ll ever pull together again.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: But I’m here to tell you tonight – progress is possible.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: I know because I’ve seen it in the lives of people across America who get knocked down and get right back up.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And I know it from my own life. More than a few times, I’ve had to pick myself up and get back in the game.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Like so much else, I got this from my mother. She never let me back down from any challenge. When I tried to hide from a neighborhood bully, she literally blocked the door. “Go back out there,” she said.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And she was right. You have to stand up to bullies.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: You have to keep working to make things better, even when the odds are long and the opposition is fierce.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: We lost my mother a few years ago. I miss her every day. And I still hear her voice urging me to keep working, keep fighting for right, no matter what.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That’s what we need to do together as a nation.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Though “we may not live to see the glory,” as the song from the musical Hamilton goes, “let us gladly join the fight.”

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Let our legacy be about “planting seeds in a garden you never get to see.”

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That’s why we’re here…not just in this hall, but on this Earth.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: The Founders showed us that.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: And so have many others since.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: They were drawn together by love of country, and the selfless passion to build something better for all who follow.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: That is the story of America. And we begin a new chapter tonight.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Yes, the world is watching what we do.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Yes, America’s destiny is ours to choose.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: So let’s be stronger together.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Looking to the future with courage and confidence.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Building a better tomorrow for our beloved children and our beloved country.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: When we do, America will be greater than ever.

Author: Clinton
Full.Text: Thank you and may God bless the United States of America!
